cab.content: Ksport on the special work of the Local Government Boardfor the week ending 6th April, 1917.1. The question of Man Power and the measures to be taken to secure more men for the Army has continued to engage special attention.2. Steps have been taken to secure the co-operation of local Authorities in the protection of crops from rats, sparrows and other pests and in the collection of waste woollen and cotton material *3. Among other matters which have received special consideration the following may be mentioned:-(a) the question of Housing and in particular the utilisation of Army hutments and other material;(b) the mobilization of doctors to meet military and civilian needs;(c) questions in connection with electoral reform;(d) reorganization of the arrangements for dealing with Belgian Refugees requiring public assistance.
